inputs.name: scriptType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path or Inline Script

inputs.name: scriptName
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the PowerShell script.  Either ordinal parameters or named parameters

inputs.name: workingFolder
inputs.label: Working folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run.  Defaults to the folder where the script is located.

inputs.name: inlineScript
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# You can write your powershell scripts inline here. 
# You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this scripts using arguments

 Write-Host "Hello World"

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely solely on $LASTEXITCODE and the exit code to determine failure.
